quote: If I had to choose one bike, it would be the gravel bike... I rediscovered my home with the gravel bike. The gravel bike is the link between a racing bike and a mountain bike. I particularly like the fact that I can get to safety from traffic and turn off-road quite quickly.
The Black Fork Gravel Grinder was a proper tough gravel race. With punchy climbs, ripping descents and some rugged sections, it was right up my alley…. 10/10 would do this event again!
No cell service, very little motor traffic, a whole lot of wildlife and green, green scenery… it hadn't mattered what I felt physically. It was so breathtaking, I was beside myself.
Loved the route, hard technical gravel, and a beer handed to me as I crossed the finish line
Had a great time! Route was really challenging and tough, but way cool. I think I clocked my fastest time on a bicycle: 44mph.
The Black Fork was an amazing reminder of community and competition for me. I was surrounded by strong women that inspire me to work harder and be better.
We thought about what suits us best, what excites us... the terrain here simply lends itself to it.
Put on wide tires, because the wider the tires, the better the comfort.
